intro: Baliospermum angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved baliospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in terminal inflorescences, often appearing in summer. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
